title: Wellness Program Coordinator (LPN)
description:
**Wellness Program Coordinator**  

**Job Location:** Midtown Manhattan, NY; 4 days in office, 1 day remote, with occasional travel to clinical sites in NY & NJ areas.  

**Job Schedule:** Mon-Fri, Day Shift  

**Job Type:** Full Time  

**Pay Rate:** $60,000-$70,000 per annum

  

**Job Description:**  

VitalCheck Wellness is seeking a **Wellness Program Coordinator** for our Diabetes and Chronic Disease Management Program, to coordinate the program, make sure there is patient adherenceand provide education to employees of our clients in the NY and NJ area. We are looking for someone passionate about improving patient's lives and delivering high level customer service.

  

**Responsibilities:**

  

* Coordinate between patient, clinical and operations partners to set up appointments, follow up, and get feedback.
* Make sure there is high adherence rate to the program in accordance with our guidelines.
* Provide education around diabetes management and exercise advice to help clients establish healthy eating habits and lifestyle.
* Support clients in diabetes management and other aspects of well-being and lifestyle.
* Establish and maintain rapport and good relationship with patients.
* Maintain clients documentation.


**Requirements:**


* Bachelor's degree in nursing, health administration, or a related field.
* Active license of Licensed Practical Nurse (LPN) in NY or NJ strongly preferred.
* Three to five years of experience in nursing, health administration, or a related field..
* Experience with educating diabetes or other chronic conditions.
* Experience with vaccine and phlebotomy strongly preferred.
* Proficient with computers, Microsoft Office, EMR systems.
* Customer service-oriented and have great bedside manner.
* Strong communication skills; both written and verbal.
* Ability to work independently with little supervision.
* Bilingual with Haitian Creole or Spanish speaking strongly preferred.
* Must be able to reliably commute throughout NYC and/or NJ.


**About VitalCheck Wellness**


VitalCheck Wellness is a fast-growing healthcare company with presence in the United States, Asia and Europe. We are changing the face of healthcare delivery by bringing high quality healthcare providers directly into the workplace and virtually. Our team builds up service models and technologies to enable companies to easily set up wellness clinics and other preventative medical services in the office at their selected times. Our team is on a mission to transform the traditional healthcare delivery model to ensure everyone in the workforce can keep up to date with their preventative care needs without disrupting their work schedules.

title: Retail Sales Associate - Rockaway Townsquare
description:
**Join the Lovisa America team:**
---------------------------------

  

It is exciting times at Lovisa with many new stores opening across America, so we are looking for our next amazing Lovisa Sales Super Stars to join our growing team.


**The Sales Associate Role:**


The Stylist (Sales Associate) is responsible for supporting the Store Manager and Assistant Store Manager aim to achieve store targets and keep the store looking presentable for our customers. If you enjoy a bright, energetic environment and you're a great communicator who likes building relationships and has an eye for fashion, Lovisa is for you!


**Our Brand:**


Lovisa was created out of a need for on-trend fashion jewelry at ready-to-wear prices. Our trend spotting departments worldwide take inspiration from couture runways and current street style to deliver new, must-have styles to our customers.


We are a fashion-forward jewelry brand that caters to every woman, with 150 new styles being delivered to stores each week. We give exceptional customer service and apply our core belief, “It's about the customer, always” in everything we do.


Established in Australia Lovisa launched its first store in 2010, Since then Lovisa has opened over 550 stores across 20 countries: New Zealand, The United States, Singapore, Malaysia, South Africa, United Kingdom, France, Germany, Belgium, Netherlands, Switzerland, Austria, Luxembourg. As we continue to grow, vast opportunities will arise and are on offer for self-motivated and enthusiastic leaders and Team Members.


**Lovisa Benefits**:


* Ongoing training, mentoring and support for personal and career growth.


* Generous product discount.


* Incentives galore.


* Ear piercing training.


* A culture that is committed to continuous improvement!


* Opportunity to join one of Australia's fastest and most successful global retail brand!


**What we are looking for!**


* Do you have a strong desire to deliver an exceptional experience to your customer?


* You possess strong time management and organizational skills


**To be successful in this role you will have:**


* Prior experience for a retailer or hospitality


* Ability to perform in a fast-paced, high-volume environment


* Must be 18 years of age or older.


* Must have open availability to work any shift.


Job Type: Part-time
company_description: To bring brilliantly affordable, on-trend jewellery to the WORLD, whilst delighting our customers with our commitment to continually improve your Lovisa experience.

description:

VitalCheck Wellness is seeking a committed and compassionate per diem **Patient Care Coordinator** with experience in phlebotomy to assist patients in making **referral appointments** and **perform skilled specimen collections** for employees at a private business in **Jersey City, NJ****.** We are looking for someone with excellent interpersonal skills and ability to create a supportive environment.

title: Dental Assistant - Bronx Community Based
description:
**Position Summary:**
As a member of the Dental Department, we are hiring **Dental Assistants** who will play a pivotal role in the day-to-day operations of the team. Dental Assistants will provide chairside support to Pediatric and General Dentistry and allow for our Dentists to provide efficient, high quality care to patients. They are responsible for providing hands-on support and completing prep work so Dentists can complete the required tasks at maximum speed and efficiency. **Minimum Qualifications:*** High School Diploma or GED Required.
* **Dental Assistant Certificate required.**
* 0-1 years of related experience in a dental setting with four-handed dentistry preferred.
* **Bilingual Spanish/English required.**
* Knowledge of Dental Software and EHR (e.g. Dentrix), highly desired.
* Ability to adhere to National Patient Safety Goals.

**Key Duties:*** Assists the Dentist with routine procedures.
* Prepares treatment room and tray setups for dental provider.
* Takes digital X-rays and impressions.
* Orders dental supplies and maintains inventory.
* Completes infection control sterilization of all equipment and instruments.
* Schedules appointments and maintains reception area as required.
* Distributes patient educational materials as needed.

**Starting Compensation:** Minimum $43,680 ($21.00) per year; Maximum $43,680 ($21.00) per year **As a full time associate at Urban Health Plan, you'll enjoy:*** Fully funded Health Insurance for you/73.5% funded Health Insurance for your family
* Dental,Vision, and prescription Coverage
* 401(k) Retirement Savings (including 3% annual employer contribution)
* Comprehensive time off including paid vacation, personal time, sick time, and paid holidays (including your birthday!).
* Flex Spending Accounts (Health care, Dependent Care, and Commuter Benefits)
* Entertainment Discount Programs
* Employee Assistant Programs
* Eligibility to apply for Public Service Loan Forgiveness Program (PSLF)
* Fitness Discounts and Perks through our medical plan
* $50,000 term life Insurance

We are currently hiring Dental Assistants to work onsite at our **El Nuevo San Juan Health Center located at 1065 Southern Blvd, Bronx NY 10459** having the flexibility to work Monday - Friday with rotating Saturdays or Tuesday - Saturday between the hours of 8:00am - 5:00pm based on a 40 hour work week.  

We are also hiring for our **Peninsula Community Health Center located at 1967 Turnbull Ave, Bronx NY 10473**. The work schedule for this location will be Monday - Friday 8:00am - 5:00pm. **About Urban Health Plan:**
At Urban Health Plan (UHP) our mission is to continuously improve the health of communities and the quality of life of the people we serve by providing affordable, comprehensive, quality, primary and specialty health care and by assuring the performance and advancement of innovative best practices. That tradition continues today by promoting excellence in everything that we do. *UHP is an equal opportunity employer. M/F/D/V. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin/ancestry, citizenship status, disability, age, marital or family status, and military or veteran status.*

title: Regional Director
description:
Description: **SkyHop Global** has an outstanding opportunity for a talented **Regional Manager- Northeast**

***Candidates must reside in one of the following Major Markets:***

* ***New York -Candidate must reside with reasonable commuting distance to Glendale NY***


Los Angeles/ San Francisco


South Florida


SkyHop Global is recognized as the national leader in airline crew ground transportation and named to the Inc. 5000 list. Headquartered in Fort Lauderdale and with offices in most major hub cities.


Our core belief is we must provide the safety and reliability we would provide to our own family. And just like in a family, we believe in communication. That’s why we created game-changing technology to manage our business and mobile apps for our flight crew customers to communicate with our drivers at the touch of a finger.

**The Regional Manager** will have overall responsibility for multiple locations. . Your primary objective will be to ensure that each location operates efficiently in alignment with the company’s core values and contractual commitments. You will also be responsible for building and maintaining strong business relationships, ensuring customer satisfaction, and driving continuous improvement opportunities across all sites. Primary objective is to ensure the location is operating efficiently based on the company’s core values and contractual commitments, while ensuring strong business relationships and confidence are established and maintained. Build account stability and customer satisfaction by focusing on continuous improvement opportunities.

**Major Responsibilities:**

*People:*

* Acquisition and development of a team that can exceed client expectations while meeting company standards
* Provides leadership for employees
* Develop, mentor and promote strong performers at all levels of operations
* Establishes the scheduling requirements for employees/agents under their supervision. Makes assignments to assure that positions are covered and that the Client is being services in accordance with their needs. Responsible for placing employees due to call offs and time off requested.

*Finance*

* Develop tactical and strategic plans to build talent pipeline through associate development
* Meet profit and growth objectives
* Drive consistent operational performance across all locations with a focus on safety, service and cost
* Ensure all operations are optimally staffed and organized to maximize performance and service delivery
* Respond timely and follow-up to communications
* Communicate professionally
* Time management
* Manages P&L & revenue growth for location
* Work with the Operations and Finance Teams to develop and implement business plans to improve financial performance year over year

*Safety:*

* Instill in the employees that safe performance is a critical element required to achieve success and is a recognized indicator of individual and team effectiveness
* Actively participate in the development and effective execution of location strategies and performance goals
* Ensure compliance with all applicable regulatory agencies and company policies and procedures
* Prepares reports, investigates, response to questions and provides documentation.
* Follows all safety rules. Observes and reports any unsafe or hazardous conditions immediately to proper authority.

*Fleet/Assets:*

* Develop a balanced fleet/asset approach that promotes utilization, safety, service and driver success
* Maintain vehicle maintenance requirement and records; schedule regular and irregular audits of unit vehicles; Other projects and tasks as assigned by the CEO

**Qualifications:**

* 5 - 10 years managerial experience, including P&L responsibility, required
* Ability to properly prioritize, implement and manage work schedules, projects and build relationships.
* Customer Relationship management
* Utilize routing optimization, Transportation Management Systems, and driver safety management tools to enhance operational efficiency and ensure compliance with safety standards
* Multi-Site operational oversight.
* Strong Financial Experience and Problem Solving / Process Improvement skills required
* Willingness to travel as necessary, work the required schedule, work at the specific location required
* Transportation/Logistics experience a plus

**Benefits**

* Company offers a comprehensive benefit package to include: Health, Dental, Vision, Supplemental Benefits, 401(k) with a company match, PTO, and much more!

**Don't miss out! Come join us today and be part of one of the Fastest growing companies!**


Skyhop Global is a Drug-Free Workplace

Pay: $125,000.00 - $175,000.00 per year


Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance


Schedule:

* Day shift
* Holidays
* Night shift
* On call


Work Location: In person


Requirements:

**Qualifications:**

* 5 - 10 years managerial experience, including P&L responsibility, required
* Ability to properly prioritize, implement and manage work schedules, projects and build relationships.
* Customer Relationship management
* Utilize routing optimization, Transportation Management Systems, and driver safety management tools to enhance operational efficiency and ensure compliance with safety standards
* Multi-Site operational oversight.
* Strong Financial Experience and Problem Solving / Process Improvement skills required
* Willingness to travel as necessary, work the required schedule, work at the specific location required
* Transportation/Logistics experience a plus
